Preterit.turoyo: aṯibazərgān, maḥatlegabe w ṭbəxle l-u=bazərgānmuklo 68; prs 49/30; deriyawmoṭbəxlaḥamuṣo “məṭbəxlax?” ummo “ašər, ṭbəxliḥamuṣo” “qay lo=ṭbəxlaxḥalyo?” mḥéle-la
translations: ‘The next day she cooked sour [food]. “What have you cooked?” She says “I have cooked sour [food]” “Why have not you cooked sweet [food]?” [And] he hit her’; 41/9

Infectum.turoyo: u=kurrəkoko-ṭobəx l-u=ḥolo 99; 69/308; ṭubxonoḥalyo, ko-moḥe-li; ḥamuṣo ko-moḥe-li
translations: ‘I cook sweet [food] – he beats me; [I cook] sour [food] – he [also] beats me’; 41/17
